results.title: Best Movies of 2020
results.byline: By Manohla Dargis and A.O. Scott
results.abstract: The screening rooms were closed. The festivals were virtual. The blockbusters were in storage. Even so, our critics found abundant and inspiring signs of cinematic life in the pandemic.

results.title: ‘Mank’ Review: A Rosebud by Any Other Name
results.abstract: Gary Oldman plays a Hollywood hack with an ax to grind in David Fincher’s reinterpretation of the legend of “Citizen Kane.”

results.abstract: Kemp Powers is the co-director of “Soul” and screenwriter of “One Night in Miami,” but his collaborators may not know just how much of himself is in those films.

multimedia.caption: “I’ve had a year that writers, creatives in Hollywood don’t get to have, ever,” Kemp Powers said.

results.title: 2 Major Movies and a Life Shadowed by Pain and Perfectionism

results.abstract: The director and cast, including Al Pacino, Sofia Coppola and Andy Garcia, look back at making “Part III,” which has been re-edited (and retitled) for its 30th anniversary.

multimedia.caption: Over the years, Coppola has reordered and restored parts of the trilogy. But he’s now 81 and with the re-editing of “Coda” has probably put his final stamp on the series.
multimedia.copyright: Mark Mahaney for The New York Times

results.abstract: “Hi friends, I want to share with you that I am trans, my pronouns are he/they and my name is Elliot,” Page wrote in a statement that he posted on Tuesday.

results.title: Barry Gibb Has a Mission: ‘Keep the Music Alive’

results.title: The 25 Greatest Actors of the 21st Century (So Far)
results.abstract: Chameleons or beauties, star turns or character roles — these are the performers who have outshone all others on the big screen in the last 20 years.

results.title: Actors Sue SAG-AFTRA Health Plan Over Changes in Insurance
results.abstract: Ed Asner, a seven-time Emmy winner, is the lead plaintiff in the lawsuit filed in Los Angeles on Tuesday; it includes nine other participants.

multimedia.caption: Ed Asner, who is 91, would  lose coverage when SAG-AFTRA Health Plan changes take effect in 2021 because he will not reach a new earnings threshold, the lawsuit says.

results.abstract: That Tokyo trip will have to wait for the millions of people who canceled flights and hotel bookings. But there are ways to bring you closer to this sometimes impenetrable, always fascinating, city.

Dave Prowse, Man Behind Darth Vader’s Mask, Is Dead at 85
results.abstract: Mr. Prowse went from being a weight lifting champion in Britain to helping portray one of the most memorable villains in movie history. But his voice did not make the edit.

results.abstract: In the 110-year history of the American film industry, never has so much upheaval arrived so quickly and on so many fronts.
The complex realities of subsistence escape “Hillbilly Elegy.” But as far back as Charlie Chaplin’s “City Lights,” filmmakers have been turning a discerning eye on destitution.

results.abstract: These days everybody wants a piece of the nonfiction game. HBO’s documentary heads, Nancy Abraham and Lisa Heller, talked about how they’re navigating the evolving landscape.
